TopicTitle: Design example for plane with only Aviation unlocked

Articles.Content:
Hi guys,

I am trying to build my first plane in Career mode with only Aviation unlocked (and all other 45 science items), but without luck - plane is not steering, so I cant take off. I am tried to use elevons, and setting inputs, but still it doesn't work.  Could give me idea or simple design?

Thx!

Try this: http://i.imgur.com/GqLQktX.jpg

Also try go faster, take off should be much easier then.

Thanks Fisk02, but I have read this article before, so I understand basics, but problem is to build aircraft with only Aviation unlocked where not many parts available 

Edited January 26, 2016 by Vybber

Something like this works,

Wide track gear for stability, thrust reversing engine to help you slowdown. Elevon1 for roll control, delta deluxe winglet for yaw and forward mounted tailplanes for pitch control.
Thanks a lot, but still you using engines and intakes from later Aerodynamics tech, but I`l try the same design with smaller engines at home

This one is specifically made for the tech level you requested.

Comes complete with flight instructions and video (link)

I hope that is useful?
Cool, thanks a lot!!! Really appreciate it!

Another example of  Aviation level craft.

What's not intuitive is, give the main wings a slightly leading edge high placement.  Hold the left shift key while placing the part and tap w,a,s,d.

Wings in KSP do not act as air foils on a real plane.

A KSP lifting surfaces only provides lift if it is at an angle to the flight path.

And, welcome to the forums!

25 minutes ago, ScarM said:

What's not intuitive is, give the main wings a slightly leading edge high placement.

This is great advice. Wings with angle of incidence can reduce fuselage drag a lot.

 

25 minutes ago, ScarM said:

Wings in KSP do not act as air foils on a real plane.

Actually wings in KSP work as real airfoils, but a specific type of symmetric airfoil, that is usually only used on aerobatics aircraft that are meant to fly equally both upside-down and in normal attitude. Ironically aerobatics aircraft often don't have angle of incidence for this reason.

 

25 minutes ago, ScarM said:

A KSP lifting surfaces only provides lift if it is at an angle to the flight path.

While it is true that cambered (non-symmetric) airfoils give a little lift at zero AoA, that is not the main source of lift for real aircraft. Most of the lift from real aircraft comes from AoA, just as it does in KSP (well, in KSP all of the lift comes from AoA). The main advantage of the cambered airfoil is that it reduces the drag and keeps the airflow laminar longer, than a symmetric airfoil at the same AoA.
Easy answer:

8 hours ago, Vybber said:

Thanks a lot, but still you using engines and intakes from later Aerodynamics tech, but I`l try the same design with smaller engines at home

Oops, I was looking at a pre juno tech tree in my science save. Replace the engine and intake with a pair of podded junos high on the rear fuselage and it works.
